nodes.text: Iridonia was a planet located in the galaxy's Mid Rim, in grid square J-7 on the Standard Galactic Grid. It was the homeworld of the near-human Zabrak species, with Zabraks hailing from Iridonia being specifically known as Iridonian Zabraks.

Iridonia was the homeworld of the Zabrak bounty hunter Sugi and her niece Jas Emari, who considered the planet to be brutal and unforgiving. Jedi Master Obi-Wan Kenobi mistakenly believed the Dathomirian Zabrak Darth Maul was born on Iridonia, when in fact he was born on the planet Dathomir, home to a tribal group of male Zabrak known as the Nightbrothers.
During the Clone Wars, Sugi's sister lived on Iridonia, and was sent what few credits her sister had left after she had paid her crew and maintained her gear.

Iridonia was first mentioned in the new Star Wars canon in "Witches of the Mist," a 2011 episode of the animated series Star Wars: The Clone Wars' third season. The planet was originally created for the 2000 Star Wars Legends young readers novel Star Wars Episode I Journal: Darth Maul, written by Jude Watson.

The 2014 reference book Star Wars: A Galaxy at War mistakenly claims that Darth Maul was born on Iridonia. However, sources like the Encyclopedia on StarWars.com have established that Maul was born on Dathomir.
